channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Solon echoes Duterte advice to Lopez family: Sell ABS-CBN if you love your 11,000 employees
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: Congress' choice to deny the franchise runs counter to a recent Social Weather Stations survey that found that an overwhelming majority of Filipinos support the renewal while more than half viewed its non-renewal as an attack on press freedom.

item.title: Foreign visitors with long-term visas allowed to reenter Philippines by August
item.description: The Philippines is lifting its temporary travel ban on arriving foreign nationals with longer-term visas starting August 1.

item.title: Roque: IATF doing Robredo’s proposals
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. yesterday thanked Vice President Leni Robredo for taking time to send her suggestions on how to deal with the coronavirus disease 2019 but said there is nothing new about the recommendations.

item.title: China not afraid of US sanctions over South China Sea
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: China is not afraid of United States sanctions in the South China Sea or any brewing storm over Beijing’s actions in the disputed waters, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday.

item.title: ‘US to use all tools to protect valid South China Sea claims’
item.author: Pia Lee Brago
item.description: Saying US policy on the South China Sea is now “crystal clear,” Washington announced it will use all tools and legal responses it can provide to protect valid claims of countries across the world which recognize that China violated their legal territorial and maritime claims.

item.title: Roque: Duque not scolded by Duterte
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Health Secretary Francisco Duque III did not get a dressing down from President Duterte for claiming that the Philippines had flattened the coronavirus disease 2019 curve, a remark that he immediately took back after drawing widespread criticism.

item.title: PhilHealth eyeing release of second hospital reimbursement
item.author: Pia Lee Brago
item.description: The Philippine Health Insurance Corp. is considering the release of a second tranche of the Interim Reimbursement Mechanism or emergency cash advance to help hospitals with the needed liquidity to respond to the increasing number of COVID-19 patients.

item.title: Government setting up one-stop shop for displaced ABS-CBN workers
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The labor department is set to establish a one-stop shop where retrenched workers, including those who lost their jobs because of the shutdown of ABS-CBN, can seek employment opportunities, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Limited face-to-face classes mulled in low-risk areas
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Months after President Duterte declared “no vaccine, no classes,” the government is considering proposals to allow the conduct of limited face-to-face classes in low-risk areas under the most lenient modified general community quarantine.

item.title: Duterte softening on ‘oligarchs’?
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte has softened on the country big businessmen, whom he has been calling oligarchs, after they poured billions of pesos to support government efforts to fight coronavirus disease 2019, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.
